intro: Choulettia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, providing a lush backdrop to its vibrant blooms. Choulettia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
